title: Warring States China Intellectual and Political History
description:
Known as the time of the “hundred schools of thought,” the Warring States
(Zhanguo) period was the formative period of Chinese philosophy and
undoubtedly the era of greatest intellectual diversity in all of China’s history.
However, the intellectual developments of this period were inseparable from
major social, political, economic, and technological changes that the Chinese
world was undergoing at the time. This course will examine the political and social changes of the Warring States and preceding Springs and Autumns
(Chunqiu) period and explore how all these various historical forces may
have shaped the ideologies and debates of the era.
prerequisite: YCC1113 Philosophy and Political Thought 1 or with the permission of the instructor.
